meanings.definition: Involving marriage to one person at a time.
meanings.sent1: Penguins are monogamous animals, staying with one partner for life.
meanings.sent2: Sarah and John have a monogamous relationship, committed only to each other.
meanings.sent3: The monogamous penguin couple decided to renew their vows with a fish ceremony.
meanings.sent4: Their monogamous love was a fortress against the storms of life.
meanings.sent5: The concept of monogamous marriage has been a tradition in many cultures.

meanings.definition: Having only one mate or partner at a time.
meanings.sent1: Lions are known to be monogamous, forming strong bonds with their partners.
meanings.sent2: The birds displayed monogamous behavior by always flying together.
meanings.sent3: The monogamous otters held hands while floating down the river, enjoying the view.
meanings.sent4: Their monogamous connection was like a delicate thread tying them together.
meanings.sent5: The idea of being monogamous appealed to them as a symbol of loyalty.
